comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Unfortunately not the HESPERUS of the famous Longfellow poem and saying 'The Wreck of the Hesperus'. Completed in 1874, the first iron ship built for the Orient Line, she was a regular visitor to Australia. More here - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/63751723

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yes that would have been interesting - Longfellow's 'The Wreck of the Hesperus' has certainly entered pop culture over the years. You know you've made it if both Mad Magazine and Daffy Duck are using your material :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Not to mention the Marx Brothers and the Simpsons too! Of interest is that this HESPERUS was sold to Russian owners in Odessa in 1899, and was renamed GRAND DUCHESS MARIA NIKOLAEVNA after the Tsar's third daughter, born in 1899 - she was known as the 'beautiful' one - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Duchess_Maria_Nikolaevna_of_R...(1899%E2%80%931918) More history and London to Sydney times - www.bruzelius.info/Nautica/Ships/Merchant/Sail/H/Hesperus(1873).html

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks Beachcomber! This has all been entered in our records. Got lost for a while there reading all the related history - poem & the life and death of Maria, very sad.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
